Reviews.Title: “Great room, good location”
Reviews.Author: tattuck
Reviews.Content: I really liked my stay at Radisson Blu Residence in Dubai Marina. I was given an upgrade and got a very spacious, one bedroom apartment with full size, well equipped kitchen (good enough for a guy travelling alone). Hotel staff was very friendly, room service met my expectations. Unfortunately gym and spa (sauna, steam room) are quite small. One flaw - initially it really seems noisy if your room faces the highway, however eventually you get used to it and don't notice after a day or two. Hotel's location is pretty good - a few minutes walk from Dubai Marina Mall, metro station and the Marina Walk. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: HKTHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of weeks in an appartment together with the family. While the hotel is not brand new and located next to a busy freeway, I was very satisfied with our choice as we did not seek for luxury. The staff was extremly helpful and friendly, and the hotel is very tidy and clean. The appartment had plenty of space. The pool was warm and perfect for our children although any sunbathing must take place before lunch. The small gym was clean and it had everything you need. The location was very good, at least for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “No frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbo2820
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as a family for almost week while visiting Dubai. I had initially chosen this hotel because of the Radisson Brand and the standards that I know from other Radisson Hotels. However I must admit that I was a bit disappointed, as the standards here are much lower than what I have been used to at other radisson, probably because it is a residence? Not sure... The 1bedroom apartment we had was quite spacious, no doubt about that, however there were obvious signs of wear and tear in the room, a testimony that some refurbishing is definitely needed. We were also quite surpised to see that the kitchen was not as well appointed as described on the homepage (e.g. there was no microwave oven and no dishwasher! -- at least in the 1 bedroom apartment as we were told when I mentioned that to the staff). On the positive side, the staff is VERY helpful and the location is excellent, close to the beach and Jumeirah walk and the Dubai Mall where there is a Waitrose supermarket. The hotel is situated on a busy street though which you can hear (but get used to quite fast. Also note that this is due to the fact that the door to the balcony are not soundproofed, meaning that you are more likely to be bother by the noise if you take a sudio rather than a 1 bedroom apartment where the windows in the bedroom are much better isolated). I wouldnt rule out coming back to this hotel, but it will not be my first choice. Peobably another residence in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not for a personal trip”
Reviews.Author: SophieDanby
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel on business and really cannot complain, however would not recommend it for personal trips. The pool remains mostly in the shade all day (so no sunbathing) and the hotel is located next to a very busy road so it definitely wouldn't be relaxing. The rooms are large and to a good standard and the staff are super efficient and friendly, but I would question what makes this hotel 5* because it doesn't offer the luxury you expect. The hot water also appears to be on a timer so the shower gets very cold after about 1.5 minutes! It is conveniently located near a metro station (5 mins) and the Marina mall (2 mins) and is also fairly central. Essentially not a bad experience, but I would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average really is the word”
Reviews.Author: Stefkam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice modern and clean but way out of the central areas of Dubai. The rooms are clean and have nice facilities. However, as most pictures on hotel websites, also here they do not represent the reality. The architect must hate bathrooms!! We travel a lot but we have never seen such small bathrooms! Trust me I'm not exaggerating when I say they are small they are! I hurt myself everyday whilst taking a shower. Just turning around in the shower was a task on its own. Forget using the bathroom with 2 people! Really strange because the rest of the room and living room was quite spacious. The staff are friendly. The breakfast is ok but really not more than average. The 3rd day you are out of options on what to choose from. The hotel is really basic, so don't expect too much. You are able to get a good night sleep though and that is also pretty important! If you go on business, this hotel is not central at all. I guess for holiday the location is acceptable but not great.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable week”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystravelling3
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Radisson Blu Residence Dubai Marina. I travelled with friends and we shared a two bedroom apartment. The location of the hotel is quite good. Near enough to the beach to walk. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable. Both rooms had an en-suite bathroom and there was a third toilet as well. The bathrooms have nice amenities. The kitchen is fully equipped and has a dishwasher and a washing machine and drier. The room was on the 20th floor, so we had a pretty good view of the sea, as well as of the skyscrapers. No noise, in spite of the proximity of the busy roads. We rented a car and parked just outside the door every day, in the hotel parking. The staff was always extremely friendly and tried their best to help in any situation. The concierge organized a car to pick us up at the airport, booked tours, provided beach bags with towels for the beach, booked tables in restaurants and also offered a complimentary shuttle service to the beach, to Dubai Mall and more. There are many nice restaurants in the area called The Walk, just by the sea, as well as the Marina Mall next door, with an excellent Waitrose supermarket. So overall, very good value for money. It's a pity, though, that the outdoor pool was in the shade quite early in the afternoon. The water is very warm, though. If you don't get there early, the few loungers get taken up quite quickly. There is also an indoor pool which is ladies only, but I didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Central”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCeltic
Reviews.Content: I Had a one bedroom apartment on 9 th floor. Very clean and practical not homely. Two swimming pools one dedicated to women and a general outdoor pool. Sun shade from hotel makes it comfortable only till one pm. Breakfast not worth it better going down on the marina front to a local restaurant. Staff attentive to your needs. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really my style of accommodation..”
Reviews.Author: Tokkelosh
Reviews.Content: and here's why...We stayed during December 2011 for four nights.The front desk staff was very friendly and helpfull.This was the best thing about our stay here.The lady helped with our flight bookings and the doorman kept our luggage untill the rooms was ready,also managing to book us a desert safari when we could not find availablility.We had rooms overlooking the very busy highway,despite booking months in advance and asking for a nice view and quiet rooms....the noise is terrible...but to be fair,one gets used to it and it did not really affect our sleep.I think that the advert this hotel have on their website is misleading as it is a block away from the marina and has no view of it.The beach is within walking distance but with all the beach stuff etc its really too far to be a comfortable walk.The same with the Metro stop-one can walk but its a bit far with shopping bags etc.The hotel has no bar!!So no nice cold beer after a hot day...a definate thumbs down!The rooms itself is nice and comfortable with all one needs-but the decor is so bland!!Get a new interior designer,please!Beige on beige on beige!!The pool area is not inviting and looks as if nobody cares....All in all,not what I had expected and too far away from central locations.Some small shops near the hotel can provide one with self catering foodstuffs and there are restaurants near.We did not eat at the hotel but had a meal and drinks(!!) at the Yacht Club overlooking the Marina which was nice.All in all we would not stay here again,sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Jan I
Reviews.Content: We were greeted warmly at 2.30 in the morning. The staff showed us our room and explained everything to us even in the middle of the night (and even though we wanted to go to bed:-)). The junior suite was huge, modern, and clean. It even had a washing and a Nespresso machine and a spacious patio. Breakfast unfortunately wasn`t included in the price. It took place at an Asian restaurant (which was weird to us), the selection was alright but not outstanding and it was expensive for what we had been given.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but a fair way out”
Reviews.Author: PickyglobetrotterUk
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, large, clean rooms. However, aircon did not work on arrival (26 degrees I'm room at 3.30am...)This was resolved the next day. Hotel is decent value for DXB but is a good 25 minutes by metro or taxi to more central locations

Reviews.Title: “Serviced apartment with great view”
Reviews.Author: skhemka
Reviews.Content: Serviced apartment with great view and it has a great restaurant. the room service is limited but they have very many take aways nearby. the pool is very nice and they have indoor pool for ladies only heated as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, staff and Facilities BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: NicandNat
Reviews.Content: ....we found that the deluxe apartments are not worth the extra money we paid for on our recent New Years Eve trip. There were 4 of us (all adults) but discovered only a 2 seater in the lounge and again only 2 seats on the balcony. The room was very plain and lacked colour and style but did have all the things we needed like toaster, glasses etc. For a deluxe apartment you would normally find an IPOD docking station and bath robes but there weren't any of these. The TV in the master bedroom didnt work and the shower screen in the second bedroom leaked. HOWEVER, To be fair the staff were lovely, the location was perfect for us and the hotel facilities such as the pool, sauna, steam etc were fantastic. The complimentary wifi was also a bonus, the apartments just seemed very average compared to others close by....maybe a little TLC, colour and a few added extras to the deluxe apartments would justify the higher rates.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely minimalist style”
Reviews.Author: MariaCB
Reviews.Content: I read on Trip Advisor that the hotel is overpriced by comparison with other similar stars-rated hotels in the area and that is a fact. Nonetheless I chose to book online a studio apartment, as the accommodation description and pictures looked very appealing. A last minute change in my commitments forced me to change dates, so I ended up with one bed apartment room for two days and then switched to a studio apartment for the rest of my stay. The minimalist style of the apartments was decisive in my choice. I am all for simple and clean designs! Both apartments were decorated with soft pastel colours and featured a fully equipped kitchenette. The amenities included my requirements: a big work desk, free high-speed internet access, a flat-screen TV and a safe deposit box. The studio apartment was very spacious and well-lighted. It did not face Sheikh Zahed road, so this posed no problem noise-wise. I had read reviews that complained about the noise and therefore asked for a quiet room. The hotel is located in the Dubai Marina area, at a walking distance from the Marina Mall, supermarkets and Jumeirah Beach. The beaches along “the Walk” are well maintained, clean, tidy and comfortable if they are private. Otherwise they are public and with no comforts, but even though very pleasant. The 1, 7 km waterfront strip can be an agony if you drive to the beach. Most of the time you get stuck in a traffic jam. Fortunately there are many other beach options if you have a car. The Jumeira beach in the Umm Suqeim area is one of them. The metro station just a few minutes’ walk from the hotel is also an alternative option to go to many places avoiding the inconvenience of traffic congestion, which is often the case of the nearby Sheikh Zahed road. Although rated as one of the best restaurants in the Marina area, I wasn’t thrilled with the hotel’s Thai restaurant. The service was sluggish and the food expensive without the equivalent quality. In general, the staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for a well equipped apartment”
Reviews.Author: Dean-Traveller
Reviews.Content: The residence is in a good position on the marina. It is just across the road from the Marina Mall with its shops, cinema and restaurants and a few minutes walk, across a bridge over the marina, brings you to Jumeirah Beach Residence (JBR) near the sea with more dining options and pleasant places to walk. It is a 200 metre or so walk to a metro station and 50 metres down to the walk around the marina. The staff were very helpful and the concierge service excellent. There is a well equipped gym and the pool is of a decent size, with areas of sun and shade around it. It is open until late in the evening. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. It was large, comfortable and well equipped. There is free wifi in the apartments and throughout the hotel. We chose not to eat in either of the restaurants preferring to walk the short distance to the restaurants on the marina side walk, but they looked to have a reasonable menu. There was enough kitchen equipment to allow us to prepare meals. The balcony was large and gave views across the marina to the sea. The air-conditioning was excellent and there was little noise in the apartment when the patio door was closed. We would choose an apartment holiday at Dubai Marina to allow the freedom and space that is not afforded by hotels. We would consider staying here again on our next business trip or family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Apt for leisure or business stay.”
Reviews.Author: yaserkangani
Reviews.Content: This apartment by Radisson Blu is located in Dubai Marina and in very close proximity ( Walking distance ) to JBR ( Jumeirah Beach Residence ) which is a nice place in Dubai for walking and having a meal close to Sea in one of the many restaurants located at the walk street. I stayed in a Two bedroom apartment and I can say they have all you may need during your stay, amenities are really nice and everything is there for you to have an enjoyable stay. Beds where comfy, bathrooms were clean and modern, staff were really friendly and also if you are driving, they have parkings available free of charge, the only thing I didn't like was the breakfast, choices were limited, but overall I had nice memories of my stay with them. There is one thing really good and its there high speed free WiFi internet access through the hotel in case you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Husainbaj
Reviews.Content: The Hospitality of the Hotel is good but need to request the Hotel Staff to Clean up the rooms twice or thrice a week. The Club House and all the Equipment's at the Gym are good. Swimming pool is awesome and missing a squash playroom there. A perfect hotel for Family and Business Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomad62
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a month and found the service to be very good and the staff excellent. The hotel has a mix of hotel room, 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom apartments. However please note if you are here for an extended stay the 1 bedroom apartments do not have a full kitchen as there is no dishwasher and the fridge is a large bar fridge. The best rooms are those away from the 10 lane freeway, however even in these rooms you will here the drone of traffic, it eventually becomes white noise. The hotel is a block from Marina Mall which has some decent shops, restaurants, cinemas and a Supermarket, other restaurants are close by ot the Marina a 10 minute walk. The other thing to know about this hotel is that it is DRY, no alcohol is served.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with special A+ for internet and staff”
Reviews.Author: JMX2016
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for 6 nights, oct 19th to 25th. I got a 1 bedroom suite. Very comfortable and very well decorated. This included 1 kitchenette, 1 toilet, 1 bathroom, 1 balcony, 1 living room and 1 room (with both a flat-screen tv). The price was quite high but according to the Dubai prices. My first priority when i book a room in any hotel is free Internet. It was the case here and it was fast, working perfectly. As I was there to study/work, I have asked for a room on the opposite side of Zayed road, high in the floors. The extremly courteous and nice staff allocated me a room on the 17th floor, according to my request. The traffic noise is still very loud on this side and why the windows are not sound proof is a mystery but i have to say it didn't annoy me much as I was not directly facing the highway. The Marina walk is 10 minutes walk away and the Marina mall 5 minutes walk. You will find there a very nice supermarket and a food court with really good choices. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel. I tried the thai and it was delicious and not too expensive. The staff at Radisson is to be praised. There are really nice and extremly friendly with no exception! I havent tried the pool or the gym (which is quite small)

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for business but nothing extraordinary or to remember”
Reviews.Author: profeoosr
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay for business travellers; decent service, nice appartments/suites, and particularly if you stay for a longer time period, a place to use a base for more than just a hotel stay. Good restaurants in hotel (2) but little other servieces, no bar area, no lobby service etc. Nice pool and excellent gym, however.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: natandpete
Reviews.Content: We (as a family) stayed for three months at the Radisson Blu when we first arrived in Dubai. It is a wonderful hotel that is incredibly family friendly. The staff where absolutely wonderful. Always so accommodating and so positive. We were very sad as a family to leave the hotel, as we had become so well acquainted with the staff. They really made our transition into being residents in Dubai incredibly pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: othmane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last week for 4 nights attending an exhibition in Dubai and absolutely loved this hotel, rooms are very spacious and clean, with everything you need, we've been allocated a room with marina view, Staff is very friendly and helpful, The Walk in JBR and the beach is about 8 minutes on foot, just need to cross the bridge and the lovely marina, pool is lovely, there is also free wifi. I will definitely go back to this hotel and will also recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms overlooking the main road and not the marina, as the website leads you to believe.”
Reviews.Author: The_Purple_Witch
Reviews.Content: We have just checked in last night being here on our honeymoon, and at the time of booking we requested a balcony with a marina view. We have instead been given a balcony directly over a busy main road. We asked last night if we could change to a quieter room with a marina view and were told to phone this morning and they will change us. This morning we have now been told that all of their standard studio rooms overlook the road! We were extremely disappointed as the website would lead you to believe that you get marina views! We are also disappointed that we have had mixed messages from the staff. The hotel is clean and comfortable and in a good location but we would not have chosen this hotel for our honeymoon if we'd have known how noisy the rooms were going to be!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nataliepLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week- we were coming to Dubai for a friend's wedding so didn't want somewhere too expensive. This hotel offered great value for money, as being slightly further from the beach it was less expensive but still really nice. The beach was only a ten minute walk away...The rooms were really spacious and modern and the bathroom was great too. the only criticism would be that the pool gets shady in the afternoon so you can only really use it until 1pm....The gym was good though. All in all, a great hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: VTB
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quite room after reading the reviews, got a quite room but no balcony. We asked for a room with a balcony,not a problem moved us within 5 minutes. The room was on the first floor so it was abit noisy,didn't mind as we enjoyed sitting on the balcony. The veiw at night made up for this and you did get use to the traffic. Good location Metro 5 mins away Marina round the corner, JBR over the bridge and the mall just 5 mins away. Loved going to the Aquara Lounge on the Marina, for happy hour 6pm till 7.30pm. The bar has a nice outside decking area over looking the marina. Would stay at the Radisson Blu again

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Swedeflyer
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Very good location in Dubai Marina with only a short walk to JBR open beach, Metro station, Marina Walkway, and Marina Mall with a fab Waitrose supermarket. - Modern design. - Very friendly, helpful and efficient staff. - Very nicely furnished and large studio room with good kitchen equipment. - Very good housekeeping and cleaning. - Beach towels a nice touch. Cons: - The noise from the motorway on the lower floors and the fact that the rooms despite the motorway noise have no soundproofing which is rather surprising in a modern building. - Note that almost all the studio rooms are on the lower floors facing the motorway so you will get such a room even if you request a quiet room. - There are a lot of smoking rooms and you are not guaranteed a non-smoking room even if you request one. - Pool is in the shade after 11 am. It is a very good place to stay in Dubai Marina which is the area where you really want to stay if you want to be able to walk around instead of taking a taxi just to get to the beach, mall or metro.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dipex
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning from Australia for possible pre check-in. Hotel wanted to charge an extra 720 dhms as 'day rate', which I thought was on the high side, especially since they had a vacant room available, albeit not a non smoker I had requested. On five other occasions Dubai hotels have waived additional charges for an early check-in. I suppose it depends on how hotels wish to engender customer relations with guests on arrival. The room was somewhat disappointing and was one of the least attractive in the hotel. It was on the second level and faced the Sheikh Zayed Road (the main freeway). There was no carpeting on the stone tiled floor, even by the bed. The noise from constant traffic meant that the balcony served no purpose. I couldn't even hear the tv because of the noise level outside and the tv had a very quiet maximum volume level. The positives: after some negotiation, the hotel did agree to reduce the day charge by 50%; the bed and bedlinens were heavenly and the most comfortable I have slept in; There is free wi-fi and the hotel staff were very good in asisting me with an internet connection. The hotel is within easy walking to Dubai Marina Mall and the marina restaurants, both of which offer an excellent selection of eateries. The beach and metro stop are also withing easy distance. I might consider a future stay in Radisson Blu only if the room was on a high floor, quiet and partly carpeted.

Reviews.Title: “Decent friendly priced family hotel”
Reviews.Author: REKV
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel when travelling with family. We stayed in a 2 bedroom appartment that provided sufficient space for a family of 3 or 4. Even on the 13nd floor, the noise of trafic at Sheik Zayed road is considerable, so best to aks for a room not facing Zayed road. The beach is only a 10 min walk away, with lots of restaurants around. Breakfast is overpriced (as usually in hotels), better go to the Waitrose supermarket in the Marina mall. Taxi's to the city center and malls are well available and not expensive. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel has good deals, e.g. when staying 4 nights, check their website.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for value/money”
Reviews.Author: Maksim_Popov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite comfortable with very good location: about 10 minutes afoot till the beach and metro station, close proximity to Seikh Zayed road means quick access to the city attraction by taxi. The room is large and very well equipped with kitchen amenities. Some disadvantages: (1) we had a room on the first floor with windows facing Seikh Zayed road so the road noise was a little bit disappointing (but not to much to ask for another room). So it’s recommended to ask for the room as high as possible not facing Seikh Zayed road. (2) the breakfast in the hotel’s Thai restraint is not worth its money - after two mornings we decided to had a breakfasts in restaurants and cafes situated on the Promenade (10 minutes afoot in Dubai Marina Walk) or bought some food in the Waitrose supermarket in Dubai Marina Mall. Nevertheless, our vacation was comfortable and I can recommend this hotel. Maksim, Russia

Reviews.Title: “Attractive rooms but design flaws”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are attractively modern with big flat tvs. The beds are comfortable and there is free wifi. There are some design flaws. Firstly the bathroom didn't have enough lighting. The modern sinks are so shallow you get water splashing back on you. One of the bedrooms had a light switch in a very strange place hidden behind a headboard. The washer dryer is strange. Washed my clothes but the drying didn't seem to work. They should have separate washers and dryers. The beds have rather sharp wood frames that can make for painful knocks. So be careful. Location: there is a supermarket in the next service apartment. The setting is not that attractive - its on the main road not the marina itself unlike some other residence hotels. The Thai restaurant is attractive but the food was expensive and wasn't good. I left a souvenir behind in the room when I checked out and called the hotel to check on it 2 days later. They said they would call me at my new hotel to let me know if they found it but they never called back. It wasn't valuable so I let it go but would have appreciated a call back. Bear in mind there is a lot of competition in the area eg Marriott, Dusit etc so shop around.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Residence, Dubai Marina
HotelInfo.Address: 392-260 Street K | Dubai Marina, Dubai, United Arab Emirates (Formerly Radisson SAS)
